intro: Orthophytum glabrum, commonly known as the smooth orthophytum, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of white, powdery wax. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of indoor environments.
